content:
Instead, we should make it possible to rename an archived stream (if necessary) when a user is creating a new stream. This will also simplify the process when we (eventually) implement the ability to unarchive streams.

We already have a tool to un-archive streams (#26236).
Ah, cool. Does this mean folks can do it using the API, it's just not in the UI?
It's a command-line tool only right now.

We should probably update https://zulip.com/help/archive-a-stream, which currently says: "Archiving a stream is currently irreversible, but we plan to add support for unarchiving streams in the future."
4 messages were moved here from #design > archived streams (renaming) by Alya Abbott.
What exactly happens when you unarchive? Is everyone unsubscribed?
Are other stream settings the same as prior to archival?
It's set to invite-only, public-history, and not web-public, and all organization owners are subscribed.
@David Rosa Would you be up for taking a pass at updating this documentation?
We might want to rename the management command unarchive_stream as part of documenting it.
I rebased/updated the PR. Should I add a commit to rename reactivate_stream > unarchive_stream? Otherwise, I think the PR is good to go.
@David Rosa yeah, go ahead and add that rename; it was discussed in #backend > reactivate_stream management command and it seems consensus is to do so.
